results.byline: By Hallie Golden, Mike Baker and Adam Goldman
results.title: Suspect in Fatal Portland Shooting Is Killed by Officers During Arrest
results.abstract: Law enforcement agents killed Michael Forest Reinoehl while trying to arrest him, four officials said. He was being investigated in the fatal shooting of a supporter of a far-right group.

media.caption: Michael Reinoehl was killed by a federally led fugitive task force in Lacey, Wash., on Thursday. He was being investigated in a fatal shooting at a Portland protest.
media.copyright: Joshua Bessex for The New York Times

results.byline: By Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs
results.title: After 6 Murder Trials and Nearly 24 Years, Charges Dropped Against Curtis Flowers
results.abstract: Mr. Flowers had faced the possibility of a seventh trial in the quadruple-murder case from Mississippi.

media.caption: Curtis Flowers, center, as he exited the Winston-Choctaw Regional Correctional Facility in Louisville, Miss., in 2019.

results.adx_keywords: Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Black People;Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Black Lives Matter Movement;Prude, Daniel (d 2020);Rochester (NY)
results.byline: By Sarah Maslin Nir, Michael Wilson, Troy Closson and Jesse McKinley
results.title: 7 Police Officers Suspended as a Black Man’s Suffocation Roils Rochester
results.abstract: Daniel Prude, who was having a psychotic episode, died after police officers placed a mesh hood over his head in March.

media.caption: Protesters gathered at the site where Daniel Prude was fatally injured as the Rochester police tried to detain him in March. It was not until Wednesday that gruesome video of the encounter was made public.
media.copyright: Joshua Rashaad McFadden for The New York Times

results.title: At Least 4 Boats Sink During ‘Trump Boat Parade’ in Texas, Officials Say
results.abstract: No injuries were immediately reported at the event, which was taking place on Lake Travis.

media.caption: Owners of boats of “all shapes and sizes” were encouraged to participate and to decorate their craft with “as many Trump flags” as possible at the event in Lake Travis in Texas, a Facebook page said.

results.byline: By Apoorva Mandavilli
results.title: Your Coronavirus Test Is Positive. Maybe It Shouldn’t Be.
results.abstract: The usual diagnostic tests may simply be too sensitive and too slow to contain the spread of the virus.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: Tests authorized by the F.D.A. provide only a yes-no answer to infection, and will identify as positive patients with low amounts of virus in their bodies.

results.abstract: The decision by New York’s attorney general comes more than five months after Daniel Prude died of suffocation after officers in Rochester, N.Y., placed a hood over his head.

results.title: Chadwick Boseman, Who Starred in ‘Black Panther,’ Is Mourned as a ‘Superhero’

results.title: Aleksei Navalny Was Poisoned With Novichok, Germany Says
results.abstract: The German government said that toxicology tests showed the Russian opposition leader was poisoned with a nerve agent from the same class used in a 2018 attack in Britain on an ex-Soviet spy.

results.title: Trump Selects Amy Coney Barrett to Fill Ginsburg’s Seat on the Supreme Court
results.abstract: The president’s nomination of Judge Barrett, a favorite of conservatives, to replace Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, will kick off a furious and unprecedented scramble to confirm her in the Senate before Election Day.

results.title: Trump Supporters Disrupt Early Voting in Virginia
results.abstract: A group waving Trump flags and chanting “four more years” created a commotion at a polling location in Fairfax, Va. A county official said some voters and staff members felt intimidated.

results.title: Justice Dept. Intervenes to Help Trump in E. Jean Carroll Defamation Lawsuit
results.abstract: Government lawyers made the unusual move of seeking to take over President Trump’s defense in a suit brought by Ms. Carroll, who has accused Mr. Trump of raping her in the 1990s.
